{{MedAbbrev|L|N}} {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Sortable table ! scope="col" | Abbreviation ! scope="col" | Meaning |- | M || murmur ([[heart murmur or heart attack that can cause death]]) |- | MACE || Major Adverse Cardiovascular Events |- | MAC || Mycobacterium avium complex |- | MAE || moves all extremities |- | MAHA || [[microangiopathic hemolytic anemia]] |- | MAL || [[Anatomical terms of location#Surface and other landmarks in humans|midaxillary line]] |- | MALT || [[mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue]] |- |MANOS || [[minilaparoscopy assisted natural orifice surgery]] |- | MAOI || [[monoamine oxidase inhibitor]] |- | Mφ || [[macrophage]] |- | MAP || [[mean arterial pressure]] |- | MAR || [[Medication Administration Record]] |- | MARSA|| [[Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus|methicillin- and aminoglycoside-resistant ''Staphylococcus aureus'']] |- | MAS || [[Adams–Stokes syndrome|Morgagni–Adams–Stokes syndrome]]
meconium aspiration syndrome |- | MAST || Michigan alcohol screening test |- | MAT || [[multifocal atrial tachycardia]]
microscopic [[Agglutination (biology)|agglutination]] test |- | MBSS || modified [[barium swallow]] study |- | MC || [[Metacarpus|metacarpal]] bone |- | MCA || mucinous cystadenoma |- | MCAT || [[Medical College Admission Test]] |- | MCC || [[Motor Cycle|MotorCycle]] Collision, Motor Cycle Crash |- | MCD || [[minimal change disease]]harmful can cause cancer |- | MCP || [[metacarpophalangeal joint]] |- | MCHC || [[mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration]] |- | MCH || [[mean cell hemoglobin]];
[[mean corpuscular hemoglobin]] |- | MC&S || [[microscopy]], [[Microbiological culture|culture]], and sensitivity (the investigation steps in processing microbiology samples) |- | MCTD || mixed connective tissue disease |- | MCV || [[mean corpuscular volume]] |- | MDCT || multidetector row computerized tomography |- | MDD || [[Clinical depression|major depressive disorder]] |- | MDE || [[major depressive episode]] |- | MDI || metered dose inhaler |- | MDS || [[myelodysplastic syndrome]] |- | ME || UK: Myalgic Encephalopathy ( = Chronic Fatigue Syndrome or “CFS”) |- | M/E || [[Microscopy|microscopic]] examination |- | MEC || [[Moderate emetic chemotherapy]] |- | MEDLINE || [[MEDLINE|Medical Literature Analysis and Retrieval System Online]] (U.S. National Library of Medicine) |- | MEN || [[multiple endocrine neoplasia]] |- | MeSH || [[Medical Subject Headings]] (U.S. National Library of Medicine) |- | MET || [[metabolic equivalent]] |- | met || [[metastasis]] (pronounced like the word ''met''; plural ''mets'') |- | MFM || maternal and fetal medicine |- | Mg || [[magnesium]] |- | MG || [[myasthenia gravis]] |- | MGN || [[membranous glomerulonephritis]] |- | MGPE || [[milligrams]] of [[phenytoin]] equivalents |- | MgSO4 || [[magnesium sulfate]] ('''Do not use''' this abbreviation. Write out the name. Per the [[List of medical abbreviations: Do-not-use list|do-not-use list]].) |- | MGUS || [[monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance]] (''unknown'' or ''uncertain'' may be substituted for ''undetermined'') |- | MHA-TP || microhemagglutination assay for ''T. pallidum'' |- | MHW || Mental Health Worker |- | MI || [[myocardial infarction]] |- | MIC || [[minimum inhibitory concentration]] |- | MICA || mental illness and chemical abuse;
mentally ill chemical abuser |- | MICU || mobile intensive care unit / medical intensive care unit |- | MIF || Müllerian inhibitory factor |- | MIP || [[Maximum intensity projection]], a technique used to enhance [[CT scan|CT]], [[Magnetic resonance imaging|MRI]], [[Magnetic resonance angiography|MRA]], and [[Positron emission tomography|PET]] images |- | MIS || [[Invasiveness of surgical procedures#Minimally invasive procedure|Minimally Invasive Surgery]]
Mullerian Inhibiting Substance |- | MLC || mixed lymphocyte culture |- | MLE || midline [[episiotomy]] |- | MM || [[myeloid metaplasia]]
middle meningeal
multiple myeloma |- | M&M || morbidity and mortality |- | MMFR || midmaximal flow rate |- | MMI || [[maximum medical improvement]] |- | MMK || Marshall–Marchetti–Kranz procedure |- | MMM || [[HEENT examination|moist mucus membranes]]
[[Myelofibrosis]] with Myeloid Metaplasia |- | MMPI || [[Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory]] |- | MMR || measles, mumps, and rubella combined vaccination
mismatch repair |- | MMR-D || mismatch repair deficiency syndrome |- | MMSE || [[mini-mental state examination]] |- | MMT || malignant mesenchymal tumor
Mixed Mullerian Tumor |- | MN || [[membranous nephropathy]] |- | MND || [[motor neurone disease]], also known as '''amyotrophic lateral sclerosis''' ('''ALS'''), '''Lou Gehrig's disease''' or '''Charcot disease''' |- | MOB || mother of baby |- | mod || [[moderate]];
[[wikt:modified|modified]] |- | MODY || [[maturity onset diabetes of the young]] |- | Mo || [[monocyte]]s |- | MoM || multiples of the median |- | MOM || [[milk of magnesia]] |- | Mono-Di || monochorionic-diamniotic twins |- | Mono-Mono || monochorionic-monoamniotic twins |- | [[MOPP]] || [[mechlorethamine]], [[vincristine]], [[procarbazine]], and [[prednisone]] in combination (older treatment for [[Hodgkin's lymphoma]]) |- | MPA || medroxyprogesterone acetate |- | MPD || Main pancreatic duct |- | MPD(s) || [[myeloproliferative disease]](s) |- | MPGN || [[membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis]] |- | MPO || myeloperoxidase |- | MPT || multi-professional team |- | MPV || [[mean platelet volume]] |- | MR || medical representative

UK: Musculoskeletal |- | MSM || men who have sex with men |- | MSO4 || [[morphine]] sulfate ('''Do not use''' this abbreviation. Write out the name. Per the [[List of medical abbreviations: Do-not-use list|do-not-use list]].) |- | MSOF || [[Multiple organ dysfunction syndrome|multisystem organ failure]] |- | MSU || midstream [[urine]] sample (used in testing for presence of urinary tract infections)
monosodium urate |- | MSUD || [[maple syrup urine disease]] |- | MT || [[metacarpus|metatarsal]] bone |- | MTBI || mild [[traumatic brain injury]] |- | MTP || [[Metatarsophalangeal articulations|metatarsalphalangeal]] |- | MTX || [[methotrexate]] |- | MUGA || Multiple gated acquisition scan |- | MUSE || [[Prostaglandin E1#Sexual dysfunction|medicated urethral system for erections]] |- | MVA || [[Car accident|motor vehicle accident]] |- | MVC || [[Car accident|motor vehicle crash]] |- | MVI || [[Multivitamin]] |- | MVo2 || mixed venous oxygen concentration |- | MVP || [[mitral valve prolapse]] |- | MVPS || [[mitral valve prolapse syndrome]] |- | MVR || [[mitral valve replacement]] |} {{MedAbbrev|L|N}} [[Category:Lists of medical abbreviations]]
